commit_list.message: updating manifest
updating version of ey_cloud_server
updating gemfile.lock
Updates ey_cloud_server and adds more information to backup logs
Merge branch 'DATA-305' of github.com:engineyard/ey-cookbooks-stable-v5 into DATA-305
updating default mysql configuration to adjust open_files_limit, table_open_cache, and show_old_temporals
handle nil results for ey-hosts
fixup Extensions section of Postgres cookbook
Add EY-HOSTS section to /etc/hosts
removing configuration options on 5.5 that only pertain to Percona-server
fixup mysql init for 5.5
add support for MySQL 5.5 under the limited access flag
reverts changes associated with CC-1071
defaults sync_binlog to 0 for all MySQL versions to address binary log performance in MySQL 5.7; 0 was the prior default for MySQL
adds echo to file for interval check to prevent warnings about empty STDOUT
fix interval exit control to prevent collectd errors in syslog
Fix collectd health check script to prevent errors at minutes 1-9 of each hour.
add 2 hour timeout on postgres starts and EBS volume resizes
update path to collectd_nanny
add script for monitor/reset of collectd, update stats password source for collectd, update rrdtool package to display graphs on v5
add build revisions
fixing package naming incorrectly referenced in CC-1047
Add percona-server 5.6.32 and 5.7.14 to address CVE-2016-6662 and CVE-2016-6663
revise versioning setting
limit mysqldump hex-blob to 5.6.21+ and 5.7.5+ only
Add hex-blob to default mode for `mysqldump` operation

Merge pull request #8 from engineyard/CC-1033

CC-1033 Make NodeJS 6.4.0 available in attributes

Merge pull request #10 from engineyard/CC-978

CC-978
update manifest for new resin
revert ey_cloud_server to resin install to address CC-1035
revise binary log purge controls for better support of Ruby 2.2.3 (ey_resin)
restoring relink functionality, bumping default mytop version for MySQL 5.7 support
modify default database to eliminate reliance on `test`
adds collectd/mysql plugin components linked for mysql 5.7, corrects password configuration for collectd monitoring
remove user/database cleanup steps for 5.7, no longer required
fix typo
update install_db for mysql 5.7
add symbolic link for mysql_install_db
temporary workaround while awaiting updated DBD-mysql
add support for MySQL 5.7

Merge pull request #5 from engineyard/documentation_and_examples

Documentation and Examples
Remove deprecated functionality from "deploy" cookbook and cleanup default lib deprecated functionality
adds eyrestore and updates resin
add filesystem consistency checks to collectd, set noatime as default mount mode for /db
add ey-hosts dependency to ey-core metadata
changing to runtime evaluation of installed mysql version, moving EBS volume processing to first step of mysql cookbook
Add support for additional internal netmasks for VPC support.
add support for Postgres 9.4.11
set default value for secure_file_priv='' to override new default.

bump percona-server versions to 5.6.35 and 5.7.17
bump postgresql version to 9.5.6
revise for 16.06 chef syntax
Add support for pending environment timezone feature.
revision to timezone service restarts
Add solo to role check.
fixup controls for setting passwords on new volume instances with .my.cnf already in place
switch mysql 5.7 to verify_ca in .my.cnf to avoid known issue with ssl
pushing ssl fixes found during QA
increase postgis install timeout for smaller instance types
Add SSL connection encryption for PostgreSQL and MySQL
skip unresolveable hosts when generating ey-hosts file
bugfix for noisy FSCK OKAY alerts
Merge branch 'DATA-479' of github.com:engineyard/ey-cookbooks-stable-v5 into DATA-479
updating lock file after resin update
update stable-v5 to 1.4.60

repo_list.description: A starter repo for custom chef recipes on EY's cloud platform.  These are for reference, and do not indicate a supported status.
Module for the 'fog' gem to support Amazon Web Services http://aws.amazon.com/
A tool for managing things worth recollecting.
Open-source solution for asynchronous, master-master replication of relational databases
